document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Muricea Lamouroux, 1821 (Anthozoa, Octocorallia) in the eastern Pacific. Part II

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Muricea Lamouroux, 1821 (Anthozoa, Octocorallia) in the eastern Pacific. Part II

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype . USNM 43449, a colony and a fragment, Elizabeth Bay, Albemarle Island, Galapagos Islands, Ecuador, 91.4 m, W.L. Schmitt, Presidential Cruise, 26 July 1938.

caption.paragraph: Figure 12. Muricea galapagensis Deichmann, 1941. USNM 43449. A Colony B-C Detail of branches, photographs: Walter Larrimore D-E Sclerites, light micrographs.
Figure 13. Muricea galapagensis Deichmann, 1941. USNM 43449. A-B Calycular and coenenchymal sclerites C Anthocodial sclerites D Axial sheath sclerites.

subSubSection.paragraph: Reported only from the type locality, Elizabeth Bay, Albemarle Island, Galapagos Islands, Ecuador.

Deichmann (1941) described this species with a specimen attached to a colony of Antipathes galapagensis Deichmann, 1941 that was pulled up with an anchor chain at the type locality. She reported another smaller and paler specimen in the MCZ (96.6 m, Albatross Sta. 3405). The specimen USNM 43449 represents the holotype.
